intro: Cercouratea venulata, commonly known as the veinal leaf fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features intricate vein patterns on its leaves, which give it its scientific name. Cercouratea venulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are typically located on the underside of the fronds.
